snippet: Speaker Melissa Mark-Viverito uses her prominence to reduce the stigma surrounding HPV, a common sexually transmitted infection, and to encourage vaccination.
abstract: Editorial applauds New York City Council Speaker Melissa Mark-Viverito for publicly sharing that she is infected with human papillomavirus; says admission may help reduce stigma around common sexually transmitted infection that is linked to cervical and other cancers and convince parents of importance of vaccinating their children against it.
lead_paragraph: Speaker Melissa Mark-Viverito uses her prominence to reduce the stigma surrounding HPV, a common sexually transmitted infection, and to encourage vaccination.
